channel.title: Minimum specs to host 24/7?
channel.description:
Hey guys, i'm really thinking about hosting from home with an RSPS server.
My PC specs are:
Intel Celeron 1.5 GHZ 1 GB of ram Graphics card: Intergrated INTEL GMA
Would my PC be able to handle 50 slots on the hardware side?
Next up is my UPLOAD and download speed, i have upgraded to the 2nd fastest in my country at the moment:
[URL=http://www.speedtest.net][IMG]http://www.speedtest.net/result/1246867719.png[/img][/URL]
Can my INTERNET side handle 50 slots?

item.title: Minimum specs to host 24/7?
item.dc:creator: @Bill1 Bill_
item.description:
@Bill1 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:16, topic:390479”][quote author=Epic Steve link=topic=486391.msg3564553#msg3564553 date=1302548649]
First thing first, use NIO when networking your server.
[/quote]

But before they jump into NIO, they should first know how standard networking is handled.[/quote]

But before they know how standard networking is handled, they should learn java.

Read full topic

item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Carazon ™:

Hm, alright then, sorry. I really shouldn’t talk if I don’t know exactly It was just my guess. I have a friend with and epic speed of 70MB down and upload. He has problems running a Minecraft server with over 5 people. Maybe it’s the computer itself, not the connection.

Minecraft is horrible. 3-4 threads per client >.> etc

Read full topic

item.title: Minimum specs to host 24/7?
item.dc:creator: @Bill1 Bill_
item.description:
@Bill1 wrote:

Carazon ™:

You’ll never get 50 slots with that connection.

Depends on:
How fast the packets are handled
The actions of the players (AKA the type of packets sent)
connection speed at the time

Read full topic

item.title: Minimum specs to host 24/7?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Carazon ™:

You’ll never get 50 slots with that connection.

I had 50 players on an allstar server with a 10mb download / .5mb upload.

item.title: Minimum specs to host 24/7?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

You also need to account for your network speed, if you have bad download / upload then the server will be prone to lag either from the server not being able to send the packets or the client not being able to get the packets to the server.

Read full topic

item.title: Minimum specs to host 24/7?
item.dc:creator: @Bill1 Bill_
item.description:
@Bill1 wrote:

Base of the server is everything.

Hyperion -

[quote=“Graham, post:160, topic:288551”][quote author=Palidino_ link=topic=381494.msg3075371#msg3075371 date=1261791029]
Jesus, 50-80% CPU usage? My server uses an average of 1-5%, and I could swear even Winterlove servers use under 20%.
[/quote]

Can you give more information about your system, how many players you had logged in, etc?

I’m saying this, as performance in Hyperion is going to vary as updating is done in a thread pool with one thread for each CPU core.

On my PC, which has a dual core 2.2ghz CPU, 2 GB of RAM, Windows 7, Java 1.6.0_16 and running Hyperion using the server JVM, I get the following stats:

0 players - 111mb of RAM used - 0% CPU usage
1 player - 112mb of RAM used - 0% CPU usage
100 players - 118mb of RAM used - 3% CPU usage
200 players - 125mb of RAM used - 10-15% CPU usage
500 players - 147mb of RAM used - 24-30% CPU usage
1000 players - 186 mb of RAM used - 50-60% CPU usage (above 50% is good here as it shows it’s splitting load over multiple cores, else it’d only reach 50%)
2000 players - 259 mb of RAM used - 88-89% CPU usage

So it does reach above 50% CPU usage when you get 1000 players online (on my system), were you testing with that number of players?

(These tests were conducted locally with allgofree bot and one other player logged in on the client).[/quote]

winterLove will be so much less efficient unless it’s written off something more basic.

Read full topic

But can my upload speed affect lag on the server? how much do i really need for 50 players? (if the server handles that much players)[/quote]

Like I said, it all depends on the server, not the machine.

item.title: Minimum specs to host 24/7?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Kieron532, post:1, topic:390479”]Hey guys, i’m really thinking about hosting from home with an RSPS server.

My PC specs are:

Intel Celeron 1.5 GHZ
1 GB of ram
Graphics card: Intergrated INTEL GMA

Would my PC be able to handle 50 slots on the hardware side?

Next up is my UPLOAD and download speed, i have upgraded to the 2nd fastest in my country at the moment:

Can my INTERNET side handle 50 slots?[/quote]

Here’s the thing. The specs of the computer make very little difference. For example, Jagex has said in many press releases that the server is running on 128MB of RAM. And back a few years(before the DirectX/OpenGL update) they said that the client could be ran with Java 1.1.

Really the only thing that matters is the server, and the questions is not “can the machine hold 50 players” but “can the server process 50 active connections at once”

Read full topic
